text:p.text:span: tab to view, add, edit, and delete appointment types and appointment templates.

Appointment types are used to set up basic information about frequently-used appointments. For example, an appointment type can be created for new patient appointments and each time it is used, the system automatically applies a current procedural terminology (CPT) code, appointment duration, visit type, and other characteristics to the appointment. Appointment types help ensure appointments are created uniformly and relieve staff of repetitious work.

Appointment templates are based on appointment types and refine them by associating with them a service location, a default encounter type for documenting the encounter visit resulting from the appointment, and clinical and scheduling instructions for staff.
To create, edit, and delete appointment types and appointment templates, the
security role needs to be set to

tab. The system displays a table of appointment types.

. The system displays a table of appointment type templates. To work with the table, see
Select the side menu. The side menu appears.
. A schedule for the day appears.
At the top of the page, select
tab. The system displays a table of appointment types.
At the top-right of the page, select
section, make entries or selections in fields as appropriate:

: To make the appointment type active in the system and available to be used after it is created, enable this check box. To make the appointment type inactive in the system and unavailable to be used after it is created, clear this check box.

: Enter the appointment code. The entry in this field appears in the schedule next to the patient. Type in the same CPT code for the visit encounter for the appointment type or an alpha-numeric abbreviation of the name of the appointment type.
: Type the appropriate CPT code for billing, auditing, or report purposes. You may also leave this field empty.
: Type the amount of time this type of appointment is expected to take.
: Type a number by which the system will sort the appointment type for display in the table of appointment types (see
) and when scheduling an appointment. The lower the number in this field, the closer to the top of the table and when scheduling this appointment type appears.

: Type the duration of the appointment in minutes to provide to the patient. The system provides this duration when the patient views the appointment, for example when it sends a reminder email. For example, medical staff may be required for 15 minutes of a 60-minute appointment. In this case, the appointment type duration appears on the schedule of the medical staff as a 15-minute appointment and the duration given to patient is 60 minutes.
: Type in the full name of appointment type you are creating.

. If your practice uses encounters and wishes to have the systems automatically create and open a type of encounter when a patient is checked in for the visit based on this appointment type, select that
: If you selected a default encounter type other than
the encounter template with the same name
: Select the appropriate dictation job type that the system will apply to dictation added to the encounter from this appointment type.

: Print definitions can be attached to appointment types. Print definitions that are attached to an appointment type this way are noted as appointment type print definitions. Resource options in this section show users in the scheduling realm. To undo print definitions being attached to appt types, you need to remove the print definition(s) from all appointment types and use the print definition editor to remove the appt type designation.
: Type a hexadecimal color value or select the

to select a color from a palette. This color applies to the title bar, the first line of an appointment in the scheduler view that shows the appointment time and patient name. If you do not select a color, the system displays the title without a color.
: Type a hexadecimal color value or select the
to select a color from a palette. If you do not select a color, the system displays the appointment body without a color.
: Type comments to appear in the
field when scheduling an appointment based on this appointment type. This entry also appears in the
view under the patientâ€™s appointment date and time.

to update the appointment type list and any future appointments made from this appointment type. No changes are made to any existing appointments based on this appointment type or any schedule templates for this type.
to update the appointment type list and also update all existing patient appointments based on this appointment type and updates any existing schedules with this appointment type.
Select the side menu. The side menu appears.
. A schedule for the day appears.
At the top of the page, select
tab. The system displays a table of appointment types.
At the top-right of the page, select
section, make entries or selections in fields as appropriate:
: Select the appointment type the template will create when used to schedule an appointment.
: Select the resource (such as a physician) that when scheduled, this appointment type template will reserve.
: Select the location where the appointment type can be scheduled.
: Type the amount of time in minutes for which this appointment will reserve the resource.

: Type the duration of the appointment in minutes to provide to the patient. The system provides this duration when the patient views the appointment, for example when it sends a reminder email. For example, medical staff may be required for 15 minutes of a 60-minute appointment. In this case, the appointment type duration appears on the schedule of the medical staff as a 15-minute appointment and the duration given to patient is 60 minutes.
: This field is not used. Do not make a selection in it.
: This field is not used. Do not type in it.
: This field is not used. Do not type in it.
. The system displays a message indicating the appointment type template was created.

Use this method to quickly create multiple appointment type templates for any combination of appointment types, resources, and locations. For example, a medical specialist (the resource) can be scheduled for three appointment types at two locations. This results in six appointment type templates:
If no location is chosen, your choices for appointment types and resources will be associated with
locations. These templates will have the same durations and durations given to patient as the corresponding appointment type that was selected.
Appointment types created this way can be edited by using the
link in the appointment type templates table. See

If you try to create multiple appointment type templates for a combination of resources, appointment types, and locations that already exists, the system will not overwrite the existing appointment type templates and will present a message indicating those that were not created.
Select the side menu. The side menu appears.
. A schedule for the day appears.
At the top of the page, select
tab. The system displays a table of appointment types.
At the top-right of the page, select
field, do the following to select one or more appointment types:
To create appointment templates based on all appointment types, select
To clear selected appointment types, select
To search for an appointment type, type its name in the field. The system displays matching appointment types in the menu.
field, do the following to select one or more resources:
To create appointment templates including all resources, select
To search for a resource, type its name in the field. The system displays matching resources in the menu.
field, do the following to select one or more locations:
To create appointment templates including all locations, select
To search for a location, type its name in the field. The system displays matching locations in the menu.

button. If the selected appointment types, resources, and locations do not conflict with existing appointment templates, the system creates and displays the new appointment templates in the list of appointment type templates. Otherwise, the system indicates one or more appointment type templates exists and does not overwrite them.
column of the appointment type template to edit, select
Depending on whether appointments have already been scheduled with this appointment type template, do one:
To update the appointment type template list with the edits you made and any future appointments, select
. This does not change any appointments already scheduled using this appointment type template. If you click this, it will give you a confirmation at the top. If you are editing appointment type

(the abbreviation), please make sure you click submit & update instead, otherwise the system will not be able to find that appointment type for any existing appointments already scheduled using that type.

This will update the appt type list and it also updates all existing patient appointments for this type and updates any existing schedules with this appt type with all edits you have made. If you click this, it will give you a confirmation at the top. If you edit the appt type
you should click submit and update.
